dublin_core.dcvalue: Mobile phone use is near ubiquitous in teenagers Paralleling the rise in mobile phone use is an equally rapid decline in the amount of time teenagers are spending asleep at night Prior research indicates that there might be a relationship between daytime sleepiness and nocturnal mobile phone use in teenagers in a variety of countries As such the aim of this study was to see if there was an association between mobile phone use especially at night and sleepiness in a group of U S teenagers
A survey study of the association between mobile phone use and daytime sleepiness in California high school students.
